kickstart.post:
# Remove /etc/profile.d files in favor of loadable modules when available if test -f /etc/profile.d/fsa.sh; then
/bin/rm -f /etc/profile.d/fsa.*
if test `grep -c /opt/modulefiles/applications /etc/profile.d/modules.csh` = 0; then echo 'setenv MODULEPATH /opt/modulefiles/applications:$MODULEPATH' >> \ /etc/profile.d/modules.csh fi if test `grep -c /opt/modulefiles/applications /etc/profile.d/modules.sh` = 0; then echo 'export MODULEPATH=/opt/modulefiles/applications:$MODULEPATH' >> \ /etc/profile.d/modules.sh fi
/bin/mkdir -m 0755 -p /opt/modulefiles/applications/fsa
#%Module1.0 prepend-path PATH /opt/amos/bin prepend-path PATH /opt/mummer/aux_bin prepend-path PATH /opt/mummer/bin prepend-path PATH /opt/fsa/bin prepend-path LD_LIBRARY_PATH /opt/amos/lib/AMOS prepend-path LIBPATH /opt/amos/lib/AMOS prepend-path PERL5LIB /opt/amos/lib/AMOS
#%Module1.0 set ModulesVersion "1.15.2"
/bin/ln -s /opt/modulefiles/applications/fsa/.version.1.15.2 \ /opt/modulefiles/applications/fsa/.version
fi
